content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia using Regex, String

function extract_julia_code(md::AbstractString)
    code_blocks = []
    pattern = r"```(julia)\n(.+?)\n```"

    match = match(pattern, md)
    while match !== nothing
        push!(code_blocks, Split(match.match, "\n"))
        md = Replace(md, match.match, "")
        match = match(pattern, md)
    end

    return join(code_blocks, "\n\n")
end
```

This function, `extract_julia_code`, accepts a markdown string as an argument and uses regular expressions to extract all the code blocks written in Julia language. It removes code fences and joins the code blocks together with new lines before returning the final string.
